meanings.definition: Persuade (someone) to do something by using deception or flattery.
meanings.sent1: She tried to overpersuade her friend to lend her money by complimenting her outfit.
meanings.sent2: He managed to overpersuade his sister to let him borrow her car for the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The salesman attempted to overpersuade the customer into buying the expensive watch by praising its design.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was filled with attempts to overpersuade the audience into believing his promises.
meanings.sent5: The magician used his charm to overpersuade the volunteer to choose the right card.

meanings.definition: To convince someone to do something by using excessive or forceful persuasion.
meanings.sent1: The coach didn't want to overpersuade the players into practicing too much before the big game.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to overpersuade her parents into letting her stay out past curfew.
meanings.sent3: The teacher didn't want to overpersuade the students into thinking the test would be easy.
meanings.sent4: The boss didn't want to overpersuade the employees into working overtime every day.
meanings.sent5: The dog trainer didn't want to overpersuade the puppy into learning too many tricks at once.
